newsitem.title: LATVIA: BANKA LAND TO CONVERT FIFTH ISSUE OF SHARES.
newsitem.headline: BANKA LAND TO CONVERT FIFTH ISSUE OF SHARES.

text.p: One of Latvia's smaller banks, Banka Land, on Tuesday said it has decided to convert its fifth issue of shares from shares with a nominal value of 50 lats to shares with a nominal value of one lat.
The fifth issue of shares now converts from 7,598 shares to 379,000 shares, the bank said in a statement. All the banks shares now have a nominal value of one lat, the bank said.

The shareholder meeting last week also backed a proposal to divide the 229,551 lat profit. Some 129,264 lats is to cover the losses of 1995 and some 99,141 lats will be used to boost the share capital by issuing shares to shareholders.
